Unknown.translation: Just as both sugar and flour being white look alike, but can only be identified when tasted (one is sweet, the other insipid).

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy pIq brn hI hym Ar pIqr hÍY; jwnIAY mhq pwrKd AgR rwKIAY [

Unknown.translation: Just as brass and gold bear the same colour, but when both are placed before an examiner, the value .of gold is known.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ sony qy ip`ql dw ieko ijhw pIlw hI rMg huMdw hY, pr sony dI mh`qqw qd jwxIdI hY jd prK ky d`sx vwly dy A`gy r`KIey[

Unknown.translation: Just as both a crow and a cuckoo is black in colour, but they can be distinguished by their voice. (One is sweet to the ears while the other is noisy and irritating).

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ kwˆ qy koiel dovyˆ pMCI kwly srIr vwly hn, pr jd boldy hn qwˆ jwx leIdw hY ik ikhVw SuB hY qy ikhVw ASuB hY[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI AswD swD ichn kY smwn hoq; krnI krqUq lg lCn kY lwKIAY [596[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, outer signs of a real and a fake saint look alike but their actions and characteristics can reveal who is genuine among them. (Only then can one know who is good and who is bad).  (596)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqvyˆ swDU qy AswDU icMnHwˆ kr ky qwˆ ieko ijhy huMdy hn pr krnI krqUq vwly l`Cnwˆ qoˆ jwx leIdw hY ik swD kox qy AswD kOx hY ]596]
